testInfo.description: Comprehensive test covering quantitative aptitude, verbal ability, and data science fundamentals

questions.question: A 9-digit number in which no zero appears and no digit is repeated has the following properties: The number formed by the first two digits is divisible by 2, the first three digits by 3, the first four digits by 4, and so on. The number is:
If 12,212,121 is divided by 111, then what is the remainder?

6 engines consume 8 tonnes of coal when each is running 10 hours daily. How many tonnes will be consumed by 9 engines, each running 12 hours daily, if 2 of the first type consume as much as 3 of the second type?

Work done by a woman in 7 hrs = work done by a man in 5 hrs = work done by a boy in 10 hrs. If 8 men working 6 hrs/day can finish a job in 8 days, in how many days will 10 men, 10 women, and 10 boys working 7 hrs/day complete it?
If Z = 2197 and R = 729. How would J be written in that code?

A certain amount is distributed among 'A', 'B', 'C' and 'D' in such a way that 'A' gets 25% less amount than 'B', 'B' gets 20% less amount than 'C' and 'C' gets 25% more amount than 'D'. If amount received 'A' is Rs. 2,400, then find the amount received by 'C'.
If the radius of a cylinder is increased by 20% while its height is decreased by 25%, then the volume of the cylinder increases by 46 cm³. Find the original volume of the cylinder.

Arun is travelling on his cycle and has calculated to reach point A at 3 pm if he travels at 10 kmph. He will reach there at 12 noon if he travels at 15 kmph. At what speed must he travel to reach A at 4 pm?

8 litres are drawn from a cask full of wine and is then filled with water. This operation is performed three more times. The ratio of the quantity of wine now left in cask to that of the water is 16:65. How much wine did the cask originally hold?

From 'A' kg of pure tea a shopkeeper removes A% of the mixture (Either pure tea or adulterated tea) and replaces it with same quantity of adulteration. If he repeated this process once more and now the amount of pure tea remaining in the mixture is (90% of 40% of A) kg, then find the value of A.

There are six members -- P, Q, R, S, T and U are in a family. P and Q are a married couple. P is one of the male members. S is the only son of R who is brother of P. T is the sister of S. Q is the daughter-in-law of U, whose husband has passed away. How many female members are there in the family?
Statements: Some hens are dogs. All frog are chairs. All dogs are frog. Conclusion: I. Some hens are frog II. All frog are dogs III. All chairs are hens IV. All frog are hens
How much does a watch lose per day, if its hands coincide every 64 minutes?
What percent of students in a school are freshmen with glasses? (1) Of the freshmen in the school, 10% wear glasses. (2) Of the non-freshmen in the school, 20% wear glasses.
options: Statement (1) ALONE is sufficient, but statement (2) alone is not sufficient
Statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are NOT sufficient
BOTH statements (1) and (2) TOGETHER are sufficient

questions.question: In 2013 there are 300 employees at Company ABC. If the number of employees increased by 200% from 1993 to 2013, by what percent did the number increase from 2003 to 2013? (1) In 2003 there were 160 employees. (2) From 1993 to 2003 the number increased by 60%.

Previous studies have shown that, since the 1950s, (A) / rates of sea level rise along Atlantic coast of (B) / North America were fast than the global average -- leading (C) / to this region coming to be known as a sea level rise hotspot. (D)

No child growing up in India fails to study the Indus Valley Civilisation, (A) / which is now more popularly referred to the Harappan Civilisation (B) / after Harappa, the first of its site to be excavated (C) / in the 1920s by British archaeologist Sir Mortimer Wheeler. (D)
A few of the technology to reduce emissions from (A) / agriculture and farming, and to optimise feed yields, (B) / are already available but (C) / adoption of the science is lagging. (D)
The end of the Cold War saw India reframe how they (A) / viewed the world, and had left it with (B) / little choice but to deepen its (C) / engagement with the only superpower at the time. (D)

Apart from plugging revenue leakages and reducing the cost (A) / of delays and fuel consumption, which is also lookalike to cut down the nation's GDP loss, (B) / according to the government, the RFID tag helps remove (C) / bottlenecks, ensures seamless moving of traffic and saves time. (D)
INADVERTENT: The company argued the breach was inadvertent and it was unaware of the court order when the automatically generated email went out.
ANTAGONIZE: Canada has decided to not antagonize India in spite of its dismal human rights record.
PAUCITY: A paucity of urea is worrying farmers for the past few days in several states in north India.

Ahead of the (A) maiden budget of his second term in office, Prime Minister (B) brainstormed with top bureaucrats of Finance and other Ministries for (C) ideas to reverse a (D) sagging economy and create jobs.

While steps to (A) enhance investments in manufacturing would be high on (B) agenda, the Modi 2.0 government would also look at steps to (C) address agriculture distress and (D) improve farm income in the upcoming Budget.
Nutritionists have long (A) observed that no one weight-loss (B) strategy works for everyone, and that individuals show (C) striking differences in their responses to different (D) diets.
A hot potato
options: A controversial situation that is awkward to deal with
A situation that is easy to deal with

questions.question: Caught between two stools
options: Caught between two alternatives to choose

questions.question: I. Yellowstone National Park is the oldest national park in the US and likely the world. II. Anyone can drive through the park and encounter an array of wildlife a few feet away.
options: If there is an error only in the first sentence
If there is an error only in the second sentence
If there are errors in both sentences
If there is an error in either of the sentences

questions.question: Which of the following sentences contains no grammatical error?
options: Each of the students have submitted their assignments
Neither the teacher nor the students were present
Everyone must bring their own lunch

questions.question: Which of the following is a supervised learning algorithm?
Which library is primarily used for numerical computation in Python?
In statistics, the measure of spread of data is called:
Which SQL clause is used to group rows that have the same values?
What is the default axis for the drop() method in pandas DataFrame?
What is the activation function commonly used in output layer of binary classification?
Which evaluation metric is best for imbalanced classification problems?
What does the iloc[] method in pandas do?
Which of the following is a dimension reduction technique?
What type of variable is 'Temperature in Celsius'?
Which command shows the first 5 rows of a DataFrame?
Which Python library is used for data visualization?
In machine learning, 'overfitting' means:
options: Model performs well on new data
Model fits training data too well but performs poorly on unseen data

questions.question: What is the purpose of the confusion matrix?
In Python, what does df.shape return?
Which algorithm is used for market basket analysis?
What is the range of correlation coefficient (r)?
What is the role of a cost function in machine learning?
Which of the following is NOT a type of neural network?
In hypothesis testing, p-value < 0.05 indicates:
